Only add quotes if not in Windows (which adds its own?)

title: Switch stdin redirect to manual. Add test
body: Also bumps some dependencies

title: Add some nu_source docs for meta.rs
body: Started filling in some documentation for the rest of the types and impls in `nu_source` `meta.rs`.

title: Do not panic when failing to decode lines from external stdout
body:
Part of an effort to reduce the number of panics, this will simply error with an informative message when we can't properly decode stdin. This only happens when an external's stdin doesn't put a newline at the end of the stream.

Related issue: https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/1355

title: Add exit codes to -c
body: With this PR, `-c` will now exit with non-zero error code if errors were detected, or 0 on success.

title: Pipeline sink refactor
body:
This updates how we sink the pipeline and opens us up to some new features in the future:

* Moves where autoview is assumed out of `run_pipeline`. This means that `run_pipeline` will now output a stream that can be later consumed. In the future, this will allow blocks to hold a pipeline and evaluate it without viewing it.
* Adds a `-c` commandline flag to pass in a pipeline of commands via a string that is run to completions. Note: stdin redirection is not yet supported

title: Only spawn external once when no $it argument
body:
Resolves https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/1309

This is more intuitive, and also ensures that certain externals that aggregate results will be possible (e.g., `wc`, `less`). Even if this is unneeded, this approach is far more performant since spawning a command is an expensive operation.

Note: Although the syntax is uncertain right now, we can find another way to spawn once per entry _and_ pipe that value into stdin. For example, `each { echo $it | ^external }` could work.

@jonathandturner I'll need you to verify I didn't break everything on Windows 😅

title: Fixed mv not throwing error when the source path was invalid
body: Fixes #1347

title: Fix $PATH conflicts in .gitpod.Dockerfile
body:
Fixes #1348 
Does this help?

title: Update more futures-preview to futures
body:
This updates more crates to use the more recent `futures` crate.

The only dependency left is `surf` that still uses futures-preview. They have an updated version in the repo that removes it, but nothing published to crates.io

title: Attempt `rustup update` on each PR
Futures v0.3 upgrade
body:
This PR upgrades all of our dependencies from `futures-preview` to `futures@0.3`, and also removes some unneeded dependencies.

Because the update to `futures` from `0.3.0-alpha.19` to `0.3.0` removed the `Stream` implementation of `VecDeque` ([changelog]), most commands that convert a `VecDeque` to an `OutputStream` broke and had to be fixed. The current solution is to now convert `VecDeque`s to a `Stream` via `futures::stream::iter`. However, it may be useful for `futures` to create an `IntoStream` trait, implemented on the `std::collections` (or really any `IntoIterator`). If something like this happends, it may be worthwhile to update the trait implementations on `OutputStream` and refactor these commands again.

While upgrading `futures_codec`, we remove a custom implementation of `LinesCodec`, as one has been added to the library. There's also a small refactor to make the stream output more idiomatic.

The impact on dependency count isn't huge. `cargo check --all-features --all-targets` drops from 488 deps to 482. Still, we're now more up to date with the ecosystem.

[changelog]: https://github.com/rust-lang/futures-rs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#030---2019-11-5

title: Fixed mv not moving files on Windows.
body:
Fixes #1338 
The `mv` operation will correctly copy files from the source folder to the destination folder.
The `#[cfg(not(windows))]` part would use std::fs::rename which works completely fine but on `#[cfg(windows)]`, rename can't be used because the destination cannot be a directory.
So when iterating through the sources there wasn't any check if the src was a file so it can be copied.
I added this statement so it also copies the file (the correct behavior of a `mv` operation).

title: Add block size to du
body:
Resolves #1323

Added a block size column to the output of `du`

title: Allow cp to overwrite existing files
body:
This solves the #1245 issue.

The changed flow logic is,
1a. if destination exists and is directory -> updated destination is the file name appended to the directory
1b. if destination does not exist or it exists and is a file -> destination is unchanged
2. try to copy file to destination

The `1b` logic can later be changed to include a `-n` that prevents overwriting an existing file.

title: Opt-out unused heim features from sys/ps plugins.
Have from-ssv not fail for header-only inputs
body:
Fixes https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/1227

`from-ssv` no longer fails when there are no rows. With `--headerless`, this means an empty input will produce an empty output. With headers, it does the same as above for an empty input, but also produces an empty output if there's only a header line.

## What to focus on

- Is this the behaviour we want for `from-ssv`?
